statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

article.headline: Furman 61, Samford 48
article.story: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn. -- Senior guard Jordan Miller scored 23 points to lead Furman to a 61-48 win over Samford in the first round of the Southern Conference tournament Friday night. Brandon Seberumbi had 10 points for the Paladins (21-9), who will face Chattanooga (16-15) in the quarterfinals at 7 p.m. Saturday. Freshman Drew Windler led the Bulldogs (12-19) with 10 points. Furman held Samford to six free throws and no field goals for a span of 10:50 in the first half, during which it extended its lead to 28-10. The Paladins led 32-18 at halftime after making 5 of 12 shots from the 3-point line, outrebounding Samford 19-7 and limiting the Bulldogs to four field goals. Samford pulled within nine points with 8 minutes to play but got no closer and hit just 4 of 17 3-pointers (23.5 percent) in the game.
